alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:31PM CDT until May 17 at 10:55AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. Sandy Creek near Cordele affecting Jackson, Wharton and Colorado Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandy Creek...including Cordele...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Speaks, Morales, Strane Park... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding occurs as water inundates County Road 283. Livestock could be cut off and should be removed from the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 29.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Sunday was 29.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.6 feet on 05/29/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Navidad River Morales 29.0 29.5 Sun 9 am CDT 30.9 30.4 19.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
